gameComponents

Class GameComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameComponents.GameComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Obstacle, OpticalObject, Ray, Target

    public abstract class GameComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Virtual Optics

    GameComponent is the base class for all the components that the user can interact with in the application

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      A useful constant, to simulate points/slopes of infinite values

      • contact

        public boolean contact(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double cursorPos)
        Detects when the user clicks on the component
        Parameters:
        cursorPos - The position of the mouse on the panel
        Returns:
        True if the component was clicked, false otherwise

      • contact

        public boolean contact(java.awt.Rectangle rec,
              int deltaX,
              int deltaY)
        Checks if a game component displaced by the amount specified by deltaX and deltaY would collide with this component
        Parameters:
        rec - The bounding box to test for collision with this component
        deltaX - Displacement in the x direction
        deltaY - Displacement in the y direction
        Returns:
        True if there is contact, false otherwise

      • sameQuadrant

        protected boolean sameQuadrant(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double origin,
                   java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double end,
                   java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec)
        Checks that the intersection point is in the same quadrant of the 2D plane as the origin point and end point of a ray segment
        Parameters:
        origin - The origin point of the ray segment
        end - The end point of the ray segment
        intersec - The intersection of the ray segment with this component
        Returns:
        True if the intersection is in the same quadrant, false otherwise

        Checks if the given point p is within the rectangular bounds specified by b
        Parameters:

        b - Rectangular bounds
        Returns:

      • isWithinBounds

        protected boolean isWithinBounds(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p,
                     java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p1,
                     java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p2)
        Checks if the point p is within the rectangular bounds delimited by points p1 and p2
        Parameters:
        p - A point
        p1 - Bounding point 1
        p2 - Bounding point 2
        Returns:
        True, if point p is within the bounds of p1 and p2, false otherwise

      • circSolsGeneral

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double> circSolsGeneral(LineEq segment,
                                                                double radius,
                                                                double h,
                                                                double k)
        Finds the intersections of any line with a circle
        Parameters:
        segment - Line segment to test for intersection with this circle
        radius - Radius of this circle
        h - X coordinate of the center of this circle
        k - Y coordinate of the center of this circle
        Returns:
        The intersection points

      • infiniteSlope

        protected boolean infiniteSlope(double slope)
        Checks if the given slope is vertical (infinite value). This works because java returns "infinity" or "-Infinity" when a double variable has value 1/0.0 or -1/0.0
        Parameters:
        slope - Slope of the line to test
        Returns:
        True if the slope is infinite, false otherwise

      • approx

             java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p2)
        Checks if the given points are approximately equal
        Parameters:
        p1 - Point 1
        p2 - Point 2
        Returns:
        True if they are approximately equal, false otherwise

      • approx

        protected boolean approx(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p1,
             java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p2,
             double pr)
        Checks if the given points are approximately equal
        Parameters:
        p1 - Point 1
        p2 - Point 2
        pr - The amount of precision desired in the approximation
        Returns:
        True if they are approximately equal, false otherwise

                                        java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p2,
                                        LineEq segment)
        Computes the intersection of the given ray segment with this component
        Parameters:
        p1 - The source point of the ray segment
        p2 - The end point of the ray segment
        segment - The ray segment intersecting this component
        Returns:
        The intersection point

        public abstract void rotate(int a)
        Rotates the component in the plane
        Parameters:
        a - The angular amount of rotation, in degrees

      • resize

        public abstract void resize(int m)
        Scale the size of the component in the plane
        Parameters:
        m - The length amount to add if m > 0, to remove if m < 0

        Parameters:

        viewRec - The rectangle that delimits what the user sees in the panel
